Posts.Content: Thanks guys, I really appreciate the feedback. I'll try and find out more about his results. That's just what he remembered about the conversation over the phone with the doctor. At what point do you get considered cured after successful treatment?
Posts.Title: Dad has PC...

Posts.Content: 2.7 is correct. It was just over 2 a year ago and 2.3 6 months ago.
Posts.Title: Dad has PC...

Posts.Content: I'm trying to figure out what to expect, prognosis, etc. My dad (66yo) had a large increase of PSA from his previous check to up to 2.7, so they did a biopsy and found 10/12 cores positive and a Gleason Score of 7 (4+3). Bone and CT scans to come this week. From what I can find, this is an intermediate risk? If the scans come back clean is there some relief?
Posts.Title: Dad has PC...
